title: Cooperative Learning-based Social-Emotional Skills and Classroom Climate Improvement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic interpersonal skills and digital device operation proficiency
context.additional_context: Learners (students or job seekers) need to acquire socio-emotional skills for real workplace environments. VR-based simulations enable experiential learning of diverse social situations with collaborative learning strategies

learning_goals: In a 4-week collaborative learning project, learners clearly assign roles with three peer learners, apply a 5-step conflict resolution procedure (problem recognition → cause analysis → alternative proposals → consensus-building → follow-up measures) when conflicts arise, and demonstrate communication and conflict resolution skills achieving over 80% team satisfaction.
Learners enhance empathy and emotional regulation skills by performing various social interaction scenarios in a VR simulation environment
Project-based assessments enable learners to convert acquired socio-emotional skills into concrete strategies applicable to real-world professional environments
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
